position.marginalia_text: Aut legendum acutè: aut agendum Seriò: vel corpus validè exercendum: vel animus suauiter

marginalia.translation: You must either read intelligent things or perform serious deeds, either make the body strong through exercise, or recreate the mind through pleasant activity. Singular things vigorously, most vigorously.

position.marginalia_text: Nemo adhuc nouit vti Seipso, aut tempore.

marginalia.translation: Until now, no one has known how to enjoy either himself or time.

position.marginalia_text: Artibus infiniti sunt abusi: nemo vsus.

marginalia.translation: Infinite are the men who misuse the arts; no man uses them.

position.marginalia_text: Vivum coeli, terra[e]q[ue] globum nondu[m] vidi.

marginalia.translation: I have not yet seen a lively band of the heavens and earth.

position.marginalia_text: Alia nulla creatura mel ex floribus potest exugere, pra[e]ter Apem.

marginalia.translation: No other creature can suck out the honey from flowers better than the bee.
The attractive virtue of the soul alone is more wondrous than that of a magnet.

position.marginalia_text: Quicquid est vnum, Politicum sit alterum.

marginalia.translation: Whatever one thing is, let the other be political.

position.marginalia_text: Tempus perditus, quod non viuidè, validèq[ue] inseruit uel Animo, uel Corpori, uel Fortuna[e]. Et preciosum est,

marginalia.translation: Whatever is not vigorously or strongly planted in the mind, body, or fortune is merely lost time. And whatever of these things is useful to anyone is rewarding.
